embeds.title: Arumba's Pocket Sentry
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Downfall

At the start of each turn, alternates between:
Deal 7 damage to a random enemy.
Apply 1 **Weak** :p_weak: to ALL enemies.
*Sentry Mode active. Target acquired. No hard feelings.*

messages.content: <red mask> + <snecko egg> taped together

embeds.title: Red Mask
embeds.description:
Special Relic / All / Slay the Spire

At the start of each combat, apply 1 **Weak** :p_weak: to ALL enemies.
*This very stylish looking mask belongs to the leader of the Red Mask Bandits. Technically that makes you the leader now?*

embeds.title: Unidentified Egg
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / The Snecko / Downfall

Identifying becomes a free action.
Unidentified cards in card rewards are **Upgrade**d.
*What will hatch? Pay $1000 to see.*

messages.content: you know what sneck egg is i think
the 5 dmg every turn
also this is reall good for an uncommon
It used to be common
Then I complained about it until they nerfed it
<mysterious egg> I think
nope
<young snecko>

embeds.title: Young Snecko
embeds.description:
Special Relic / All / Downfall

Deals 5 damage to a random enemy at the start of your turn.
*Bewilderingly adorable.*

messages.content: this is like a red mask but better combined with young snecko but slightly less dmg per turn
3.5 dmg per turn as opposed to 5
not bad for also having weakening and being uncommn
<mercury hourglass>

embeds.title: Mercury Hourglass
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Slay the Spire

At the start of your turn, deal 3 damage to ALL enemies.
*An enchanted hourglass that endlessly drips.*

messages.content: wait
how is mercury hourglass and sentry the same rarity
I like to compare it to <mercury hourglass>. It does more damage (most fights do not have 3+ enemies) and for the aoe fights the 1 weak to all enemies is way too strong.

embeds.title: Mercury Hourglass
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Slay the Spire

At the start of your turn, deal 3 damage to ALL enemies.
*An enchanted hourglass that endlessly drips.*

messages.content: Honestly I don't think the weak should be aoe.
I think I'm somewhat fine with it being more damage than hourglass in a non-aoe setting, but to also be better in an aoe setting
It is almost a direct upgrade
imagine if pocket sentry was an event relic which you have to fight empowered sentries for
damn killed chat
Eh I just think it is a somewhat basic relic so there isn't much more to say about it.

Sentry still needs some nerfs, or a rework... Something like: 
> Every 3 turns, apply 1 **Weak** to ALL enemies.
 should be balanced.
I still think the damage when compared to mercury hourglass is still too good
I'd say drop it to 6 maybe?
then its on par with hourglass if its every othet run
same damage per turns but without aoe
Yes but it also has weak
which I'd consider better than 6 damage
It shouldn't be outdamaging hourglass AND applying weak on top of that.
1 point of **Weak** is worth somewhere around 4±1 damage in a vacuum.
how did you get that number?
By magical means of doing the math to find how much value cards usually provide by themselves, and then looking at the numbers of cards that apply **Weak**.
That said it heavily depends on a card it is attached to.
hourglass on super steroids. This should probably be rare
i wouldnt go that far
one of my favorite and most picked relics, this relic is absolutely ridiculous in how good it is with the 1 weak to all every other turn
definitely have talked about it before, and agree it should be nerfed pretty significantly
Yeah overall it is too strong, but it would be a pretty bad rare.
I think if it was rare also that might not help, just because you can then get it at floor 0 which is intense
like if I had a run starting with this relic? just wow
I could see this definitely being an improvement
wait so would it still deal damage between or no?
If not I think that would be too massive of a nerf. It goes from weak every other turn and damage on the other, to weak every 1/3 turns.
The weak is reduced to 66% of what it was and the damage is completely removed. I feel like if that were to happen it would have to be a common, I would never want that as an uncommon

Nope, just **Weak**, as trying to keep both is too much.
 I just suggested the idea that should be balanced and simple while also being the closest to current effect.
 Generally speaking a passive way to continuously apply **Weak** will always be strong, and should be rarer than just a Common Relic as a result of it.

You say that, but that just says how underrated the Relic is in its current form, only reason why only few people think that it is broken now is due to fact that it is easy to miss how much it actually does in a run overall.
I think at one point I suggested a 3 turn cycle. 1st turn does nothing, second is damage, third is weak

I love the flavor of this relic, it's a great reference to the sentries fight and their pattern. It is definitely a very strong relic, it can shred artifact charges, and deals pretty solid damage throughout a fight. There is some min maxing with getting the weak to line up with the right turn of certain fights, in the same way that you might want to end a fight with your pen nib on 9, you often want to set your sentry to apply weak on turn 1 of the next fight. It probably is too strong, this removes way more artifact charges and mitigates far more damage than red mask since it triggers multiple times in a fight. I haven't done the math, but the damage also compares favorably to Mercury hourglass in any fight with two or less enemies, and is always higher than young snecko. The flexibility and utility of getting both an offensive and defensive benefit out of the same relic is also worth pointing out. I would nearly always buy this in a shop when I see it, which is not a good sign for it's balance.

I don't really like the idea of changing the flavor of the relic though. Keeping the two turn cycle of damage and weaken feels correct to me. What you could do is have it stop after two turns (At the start of each combat, deal 7 damage to a random enemy. At the start of your second turn, apply 1 weak to all enemies). That at least helps solve the problem of it destroying artifact charges so effectively, and gives it a more limited effect, making it a good relic for short hallway fights, but less valuable in longer boss fights.

Yeah honestly after some more thought and having it in a run today, I think if it was changed to rare it would be fine. You bring up a really good point about the flavor of the card, and I see that as the only way to keep it while also making it balanced
Unless you just remove the aoe weak and bring the damage down to like 1-3 (not random, just not sure what number to pick)
But I'd rather see it be changed from a common all the way to a rare
which is just funny
I think I agree that swapping it to a 3 cycle could be good; maybe have 1 "no effect round", then damage/block, then weak to all
if you are really set to weak to all
I definitely dont think pushing the relic (as is) to rare would be a nerf; I would honestly prefer it to a rare relic so I could roll rare relic more on floor 0 😂

I see that you all started suggesting ideas, so the Relic only deals damage once, and I ask you, why would you want the Relic to deal total of 5 damage in combat, at this point you can just remove it altogether.
 And before you say that it is for flavor reasons, well doing things for flavor usually just backfires and makes everything worse.
I never said to have it stop.
Yeah I just also don't want to see the relic get nerfed that hard. 1 weak every 3 turns just seems boring, and it loses the cool alternating effect it has.
It is simple, I feel like it is a flavorful enough for an effect of a __Pocket__ Sentry.
I don't think it needs 7 damage per se, maybe reduce it a bit. But I think completely removing half the relic's effects and then nerfing the other half is too much
I think it would be too drastic of a change. I wouldn't really see myself taking it much if it is just the weak every 3 turns.
I will say it again, the value that the Relic provides is way too big, it isn't just slightly too good, it's current effectiveness is comparable with some of the Boss Relics.
I would not put it that high.
Still crazy to think that this used to be a common relic
I also don't get why the weak is aoe. I still think it should be compared to mercury hourglass, as a more single targeted alternative whereas hourglass works better in aoe fights
I think a 3 turn cycle of turn 1 being nothing, 2 being low damage, and 3 being non aoe weak keeps the flavor and still is balanced

Let's say that enemies deal around 20 damage when it triggers, then it would it be 5 **Block** every 2 turns on average, sounds reasonable, but no, it is much better, to name a few things the Relic does:
-if you have other ways to apply **Weak** it extends it,
-it scales with enemies, and they will get stronger than my example,
-it rounds the damage down, so it is quite common for it to eat a lot more damage than the average shows,
-its main strength lies in AoE encounters when it quite often is, at least equivalent to 2 **Block** for every enemy when triggered,
-it also strips **Artifact** so you can apply much more impactful debuffs yourself.
There is one thing I would not agree to and it is making the description of the Relic even more complicated, and just making it 1 AoE Weak every 3 turns is close enough to that already.
True, I agree with all your points
but I'm going to stubbornly disagree because...
idk
That feels like such a massive nerf, and it reminds me of what happened to hermit (or at least how I perceived it)
There was a thing I liked, it was nerfed somewhat hard, and I just stopped enjoying it as much
I won't go on about that because that's a very emotion-based point and that holds 0 bearing when it comes to balance decisions

And also because I don't want to shame the balance team for hermit, I probably am overreacting on how bad the nerfs were. It's just a weird feeling seeing something I liked go. As weird as it sounds I have a little emotional attachment to the relic, whenever I see it I remind myself of how I "got it nerfed". I'm probably just too sentimental about a video game mod, but that at least explains my weird stubbornness.
I agree that it is hard to judge when it comes to what is enjoyed, especially when it comes to difficulty, so it usually depends on what the person designing wants to achieve.
Maybe the debuff could be changed to Temporary Strength loss (maybe, depending on amount, single-target)?
if a normal combat lasts 6 rounds (outside of infinite 1-2 turn decks) then this relic applies weak to all 3 times
ON TOP of whatever you have in your deck
a 20-30 card deck is pretty normal at higher ascensions to dilute as well as promote card draw effects
so drawing whatever the grey card is that applies 2 weak to all is about that, but you don't need deck shuffle RNG to decide how often weak is applied
this allows soooooo much customization to the deck it is silly
just knowing the consistency is every other turn is massive
metrics and numbers of overall damage are fascinating to look at, but the sheer consistency for me is wild; every other turn I KNOW the enemies will be weakened

it enhances:
-card draw
-weak inducing cards
-strength decks
-decks that are massive to reduce probability of dead-draws
even if the damage from the relic was removed, I'd still grab this relic if I could
the damage is helpful for sure, but honestly not all that impactful for the times I've utilized it
but maybe that is just simply my play style coming into hand
but it is definitely WAYYYY too powerful as it stands
IMO the effect needs to be diluted somehow, and changing card rarity doesn't accomplish that
but if it stays as is, count me a happy player 😂
I am overjoyed to have it come up as a relic I find in runs
<Arumba's Pocket Sentry> reworked:

embeds.title: Arumba's Pocket Sentry
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Downfall

Every 3 turns, apply 1 **Weak** :p_weak: to ALL enemies.
*Sentry Mode active. Target acquired. No hard feelings.*

messages.content: Pinned a message.
Massive nerf, completely deserved.
It now only applies 66% as much weak and completely lost the damage.
Still will be pretty good, especially on hexa who has no access to weak at all
Unless I've just not looked through the patch notes enough which is entirely possible
Nope, Hexa doesn't have any sources of **Weak** in their card pool anymore.
Yeah hexa feels very weird, not having and weak nor vulnerable (unless vuln was patched in?)
<Heat Metal>

embeds.title: Heat Metal
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Deal 4 (5) damage.
Apply 4 (5) **Soulburn** :p_soulburn:.
Apply 1 (2) **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.

messages.content: Huh, that's a weird one

A bit sad to see the flavor change so much on this one. The nerf was still very deserved though, and the weak was the more important component of its power. You now really want to pay attention to this relic and use it like happy flower, lining it up to get a red mask effect at the start of the next fight. There is also a certain late-game fight involving buffs from ironclad and watcher where you really want to start with this on 1 to have it trigger on turn 8. You're going to have to work harder to get that weak on the right turn in general, but it's still a very strong relic
Big fan of the nerf; well deserved and I look forward to trying it out in future runs
